Found in Hyades 3.0 20040419_0915 driver.

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Start Eclipse in a new workspace.
2. Start a java process in the command line using -XrunpiAgent.
3. Create a new Java-Attach configuration, attach to the java process, and 
profile in some data. Then, terminate the process.
4. The tooltip of the Profile button on the toolbar has now changed 
from "Profile" to "Profile New_configuration". Click on the button.

You will notice that nothing happens. This is because this configuration is 
dependent on attaching to a Java process. But since you've killed that process, 
this configuration can't attach to anything, so it does nothing.

I think some info-message-popup should come up telling the user of this (in the 
delegate?), and possibly provide a pop-up allowing the user to choose the new 
Java process to attach to.

I've also noticed a similar problem in another scenario...

1. Create a new "External Java App" profile configuration, and specify 
nosuchhost as the host to use.
2. Set some class, and some classpath, then Run.

You will see that the progress bar of the workbench starts going, and then 
stops. Nothing happens. I think there should be a msg telling the user that it 
can't connect to 'nosuchhost', or something to that effect.

I think these two problems are related, but let me know if you want this in a 
separate bug - thanks. =)

I couldn't replicate the second scenario. I get an error pop-up stating that it 
couldn't connect to the host. Are you able to reproduce this?

Yup. I just reproduced the second one (i.e. External Java App + non-existent 
host) again on the 20040419_0915 driver. I used "nosuchhost:10002", and after I 
clicked Run, nothing happened.

Not sure what we're doing differently...
